div.l: I wot wele be the cradille / I have mysgoo
Here lieth the mellere / and his wyf alsoo
And forth he gothe / on̄ twenty devilwaye
Vnto the bed where as the meller laye
He wende a cropen in / be his felaw Iohn
And be the meller In he crepith anoon̄
And caught hym be the nekke / ⁊and softe he spake
He seid þᵘou Iohn þᵘou swyneshede awake
For cristis sawle / and here a noble game
For by that lord / that called is seynt Iame
As I haue thries / in this short nyght
Swyfed the mellers doughter bolt vpright
Whille þᵘou haste as a coward ben agaste
Ye fals harlot / qduod the meller haste
A fals traytour / false clerke qduod he
Þᵘou shalt be dede be goddis dignite
Who durst be so bolde / to disperage
My doughter is come / of suche lynage
And by the throte bolle / he caught Aleyn̄
And he hent hym dispitously ageyn̄
And vpon̄ the nose he smote hȳm wᵗith his fiste
Doun̄ ran̄ the blody streem vpon his breste
And in the floure wᵗith nose ⁊and mowthe to broke
They walowed as dothe / ij pigges in a poke
And vp they goon / and doun̄ they gon̄ anon̄
Tille at the laste they stombled at a stoon
And down̄ he fille bakward vpon his wif
That wist nothyng / of this nise nise nice strif
For she was falle aslepe a litill wight
With Iohn the clerke þᵗat waked had all night
